predictions.text: At its September 12, 2025 meeting, the European Central Bank will lower the deposit facility rate by at least 25 basis points.
predictions.verification_criteria: ECB Governing Council monetary policy press release on 2025-09-12 shows the deposit facility rate reduced by ≥0.25 percentage points versus the prior setting.
monitoring_signals: Euro area HICP (flash and core) prints vs. forecasts
ECB speakers’ guidance and meeting accounts
Wage growth and negotiated pay indicators
Euro area PMIs (S&P Global) and industrial production
Eonia/€STR OIS curve implied path
predictions.rationale: Cooling euro-area inflation and soft PMIs raise odds of another ECB cut, while markets price modest easing.

predictions.text: EUR/USD spot will trade at or below 1.0600 at least once by 2025-09-20 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Any reputable feed (Bloomberg, Refinitiv, EBS, or TradingView/OANDA) shows EURUSD touching ≤1.0600 at any time before 2025-09-20 23:59:59 UTC.
monitoring_signals: DXY trend and U.S. rates (2Y/10Y) moves
Risk sentiment (VIX), equity drawdowns
ECB/Fed policy surprises and guidance
Energy prices impacting Eurozone trade balance
Eurozone data surprises vs. U.S. data surprises (Citi surprise indexes)
predictions.rationale: Risk-off flows and relative growth/rate momentum favor USD; ECB easing risk adds downside pressure on EUR.

predictions.text: From 2025-08-28 close to 2025-09-30 close, iShares iBoxx $ High Yield Corporate Bond ETF (HYG) will underperform iShares iBoxx $ Investment Grade Corporate Bond ETF (LQD) by at least 1.5 percentage points based on adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using adjusted close prices from a public data source (e.g., Yahoo Finance), compute total return from 2025-08-28 close to 2025-09-30 close. HYG_return − LQD_return ≤ −1.5 percentage points.
monitoring_signals: High-yield OAS and CDX HY spreads
Primary market issuance conditions (HY vs IG)
Equity volatility (VIX) and credit ETF flows
Default/Distress ratios and downgrades
Macro data surprises impacting risk appetite
predictions.rationale: Tightening financial conditions and volatility tend to widen HY spreads, pressuring HYG relative to higher-quality LQD.

predictions.text: NYMEX WTI Light Sweet Crude Oil front-month futures (CME: CL) will settle at or above $91.50 per barrel at least once by 2025-10-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: CME Group official daily settlement for the active front-month CL contract on any session through 2025-10-15 is ≥ $91.50/bbl.
monitoring_signals: OPEC+ supply guidance and compliance
U.S. crude and product inventories (EIA/API)
Refinery runs and crack spreads
NOAA Atlantic hurricane activity updates
Geopolitical disruptions (Middle East, Russia/Ukraine)
predictions.rationale: Tight balances into peak maintenance/hurricane season and geopolitical risks support a test of low-$90s WTI.

predictions.text: The August 2025 ISM Manufacturing PMI (headline) will print below 50.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Institute for Supply Management report on business for August 2025 shows headline PMI < 50.0 on release dated around 2025-09-03.
monitoring_signals: Regional Fed manufacturing surveys (Empire, Philly, Richmond, Dallas)
S&P Global U.S. manufacturing PMI flash/final
New orders vs inventories spread
Export orders and supplier delivery times
Energy and input cost trends
predictions.rationale: Regional surveys and soft new orders suggest contractionary conditions persist in U.S. manufacturing.

predictions.text: U.S. initial jobless claims (seasonally adjusted) for the week ending 2025-09-13 will be at least 245,000, as reported on 2025-09-18.
predictions.verification_criteria: U.S. Department of Labor weekly unemployment insurance news release on 2025-09-18 reports SA initial claims ≥ 245,000 for the week ending 2025-09-13.
monitoring_signals: Continuing claims trend (SA and NSA)
Challenger job-cut announcements
Indeed/LinkUp job postings and hiring indicators
NFIB hiring plans
Layoff announcements in tech/retail/transport
predictions.rationale: Labor market cooling signs and rising continuing claims point to modestly higher weekly claims.

predictions.text: By 2025-09-20, PayPal will publish a public security advisory, blog post, or press release detailing remedial actions taken in response to the August 2025 German bank payment disruptions.
predictions.verification_criteria: A dated item on PayPal’s official newsroom, corporate blog, status page, or an SEC 8-K explicitly references the August 2025 incident affecting German bank payments and outlines specific remediation steps.
monitoring_signals: PayPal status page and security advisories
Statements from German banks and BaFin
User reports/outage trackers (e.g., Downdetector)
PayPal social media and developer notices
Any CVEs or vendor advisories linked to the incident
predictions.rationale: Scale and regulatory exposure create pressure for transparent disclosure and remediation details.
